wikipedia_page.main: Rosalind Venetia Lane Fox Pitt-Rivers FRS (4 March 1907 – 14 January 1990) was a British biochemist. She became the second president of the European Thyroid Association in 1971. She succeeded Jean Roche and was followed by Jack Gross in this position, all three names inextricably linked with the discovery of the thyroid hormone triiodothyronine (T3).
